cons: students arent told of the correct way to approach a level questions so people end up approaching them like GCSE questions

review_title: The Staff that care are overworked!
pros: - Good colleagues in general. - Good CEO leadership gradually improving staff working conditions. - Excellent and helpful digital learning department.
cons: - Unmanageable workload. - Unnecessary conflict/friction between some departments because staff are pushed to their limits with no room for manoeuvre and operating sub standard software and IT equipment. - IT systems & service poor and poorly managed.

pros: OK pay IF you have hours.
cons:
No respect or care for employees other than plastic politeness
Minimal progression opportunities
Only offered in house 'training', no additional, actual valid, courses other than to meet legal requirements for their own benefit
Unsecure and anxiety inducing
EXPECTED to do more than you are paid for
Made to feel terrible if you do not 
Staff frequently leave due to this, meaning keeping relationships is impossible
All actions are about making money rather than for the benefit of staff or students
Many staff are on 0-hour contracts and not given many hours work
Many more points
Did not have a supporting manger.

pros: Some colleagues are supportive sometimes but too scared to speak out.
cons: Poor Management, Inadequate parking, Less pay than other colleges. Belittled by higher management in front of others. Bullying culture unless you are one of the select few. Little to no support.

pros: Staff benefits and discounts, some great colleagues (Lecturers)
cons:
Incredibly poor senior and middle management leading to demoralised staff and students.
Parking is ridiculous and nobody seems to want to solve this on going problem.
Low pay rates and little progression offered.
Often get treated poorly .

pros: Flexibility, autonomy, and benefits such as holiday entitlement.
cons: Very few opportunities for career development, non existent career ladder or succession plan.
not paid on time or right

pros:
community of staff
paid on time
cons:
disorganised management 
redundancy was not dealt with very well

Don't expect your terms of employment to be adhered to, management have ways of getting around every obligation. Unless you're one of the favoured crowd you will receive little support in your role, this college is by far the most frustrating and untrustworthy place to work. The public persona of the college is all important, it is a facade that crumbles once you have been here for a while.

pros: Good employees that want to do a good job.
cons:
- Staff pushed to the limits
- Systemic flaws in operations which slows and prevents teaching staff operating efficiently and effectively.

job_title: A Level Lecturer in Loughborough, England
pros:
Mediocre managers
Unwilling to listen
Few career progression opportunities
Little interest in educational outcomes
Culture of bullying
cons: The students were hard working but being let down by the college structure

pros: Students are great. Most want to get on and are eager to learn. Facilities and poor College management get in their way though.
cons: Technology facilities are limited. New students get shown the new hub reception and S block. They don;t show anyone B or L block which are in dire need of repair and where most IT and media is taught. Poor equipment and without lecturers supporting with their own kit it would be impossible to show things to students.  Most recent technology HND course in IT media and games has new PC's but runs only in one room. The PC's can't have software installed on them without in house IT and none of the high end computers can run either the 2 rifts or one vive that the college has and makes a big show on open days.

pros: staff, cleanliness, job role, working pattern
cons: HR, training could be better, no clear progression
Nothing much to say just want more money
